DOC.HEADLINE: SIR ROBERT COCKBURN ; SCIENTIST THWARTED NAZI RADAR
DOC.TEXT: Sir Robert Cockburn , 85 , British scientist who thwarted German radar during World_War_II , saving countless American and British planes and civilians.Educated at London University , Cockburn went_into communications research for the Royal Aircraft Establishment at the outset of the war . He headed a group of scientists and engineers who devised a way to jam German navigational radio_beams by releasing thin metallic foil strips into the air . The strips created a radar_echo , making_it impossible for German pilots to find their targets . After the war , Cockburn spent his career in government military research , primarily in atomic_energy and guided missiles . Among his awards was the U.S. Congressional Medal for Merit . On March 21 in Aldershot , England .
